intro: Myriactis cabrerae, commonly known as the Cabrera's milkweed, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Mexico. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of small, pale yellow flowers. It is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments with minimal water. Myriactis cabrerae plays a role in supporting local pollinators, particularly bees and butterflies.
